TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @misc{ePark, author = {Indigenous Languages Research and Development Foundation}, title = {族語E樂園}, year = {2020}, url = {https://web.klokah.tw/}, }

S.FORM: acʉhʉ ʉmnʉ, ’e te pa’cohivneni ta lema’cohio maitan’e zou ’ola hia bua cou tola ’o’ana.
S.TRANSL: 大家好。今天老師要教大家食物的鄒語怎麼說。
Hello everyone. Today, I am going to teach you how to say \\\Food Chowder\\\"."
Do you understand what the teacher says?

S.FORM: lema’cohio, o’a os’os’a ta’hongi, teko peela i’vaha engha?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我不懂。可以再說一次嗎?
I don’t understand. Can you repeat it again?
我聽不到，可以大聲一點嗎?
I can’t hear you, can you speak louder?

S.FORM: aiti eni! maezo a’o ho mo’engho.
S.TRANSL: 請看這裡! 跟著我唸一遍。
Look here, please! Repeat after me.
Read it again. Please speak louder.
I forgot to bring my pen.

S.FORM: naho cu tuyafa na’a na smaofsusu.

S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my eraser.

S.FORM: naho eno yuevaho to smaofsusu ta mimu suepohʉ.
S.TRANSL: 請跟旁邊同學借橡皮擦。
Please borrow erasers from your classmates.

S.FORM: tetoc’o ac’ʉhʉ tan’e, tato yupa bobaito ho tena mainsohʉ.
S.TRANSL: 我們就上到這邊，下週再見。
Class dismissed, see you next week.

S.FORM: ’a oko to yavai a’o, zou mo’o ’o ongko’u.
S.TRANSL: I am the son of yavai, my name is mo'o.

S.FORM: ’a letmopsʉ to yavai a’o, zou fa’ei ’o ongko’u.
S.TRANSL: I'm a student of yavai, my name is fa'ei.

S.FORM: zou cumas’a na ongko no amosu?

S.TRANSL: He is my brother, his name is pasuya.
她是我的朋友，她的名字是motoyʉ。
She's my friend and her name is motoy_289.
How many brothers and sisters do you have?

S.FORM: mo yoso ’o ohaeva’u ho cihi ’o ohaesa’u.
S.TRANSL: 我有兩個兄姐，一個弟妹。
I have two brothers and sisters and one younger brother and sister.

S.FORM: mo pio na mimu cono emoo?
S.TRANSL: How many people are in your family?
There are four of us in our family.

S.FORM: cuma na lasi hioa ta amosu coni?
S.TRANSL: 你的舅舅從事什麼工作?
What does your uncle do for a living?

S.FORM: pano lasi hioa ta ohaeva nosu mamespingi?
S.TRANSL: Does your sister have a job?
他們兩個人是兄弟姐妹嗎?

S.FORM: zou, ’a cou ta psoseongana na a’o.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I am a Zou from Alishan.
Yes, but she's from the Paiwan tribe.

S.FORM: mio, mimza acʉhʉ na’no baankake ’o mimza cono emoo.
S.TRANSL: Yes, we are all very tall.

S.FORM: leac’u tmopsʉ na ohaesa nosu mamespingi?
S.TRANSL: Does your sister go to school?

S.FORM: lea meelʉ bua cou na ohaesasu?
S.TRANSL: Do your siblings speak the language?

S.FORM: zou,’a lea hin’i meelʉ bua cou.
S.TRANSL: Yes, they speak the ethnic language.
How many brothers and sisters do you have?
I have three brothers and sisters.

S.FORM: leako no’upu no emoo no amosu ho inosu?
S.TRANSL: 你和爸爸媽媽一起住嗎?
Do you live with your parents?

S.FORM: zou, ’a la’u no’upu to amo’u ho ino’u.
S.TRANSL: 是，我和爸爸媽媽一起住。
Yes, I live with my mom and dad.

S.FORM: leako no’upu no ak’i ho ba’isu?
S.TRANSL: 你和爺爺奶奶一起住嗎?
Do you live with your grandparents?

S.FORM: o’a, ’ala’us’a no’upu to emoo to ak’i ho ba’i.
S.TRANSL: 不，我沒和跟他們一起住。
No, I didn't live with them.

S.FORM: leako no’upu no emoo no sia?
leamza noteuyunu ’o amo. ino, ho ohaeva no’u hahocngʉ.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥住在一起。
I live with my father, mother and brother.

S.FORM: tako la yuovei no yousu ho homna?
S.TRANSL: 你什麼時候會回去部落?
When are you going back to the tribe?

S.FORM: ta’u la yuovei ho tena tosvo no homu’eina.
S.TRANSL: I will go back in the summer.
I am a child of the Tsou people.

S.FORM: micu espayo si hie. mo na’no mu’ei.
S.TRANSL: The sun is coming out, it's very hot.
Is it going to be cold outside?

S.FORM: mo na’no soyʉmʉ, te aʉyʉcʉ sʉ’eʉsʉ.
S.TRANSL: It's cold, so wear more clothes.

S.FORM: o’a mios’a, micu poepe, na’no sohuyu.
maitan’e o’a mo soyʉmʉ, o’a mo mu’ei,mo na’no sohuyu.
S.TRANSL: 今天不冷也不熱，很舒服。
It's neither cold nor hot today, very comfortable.

S.FORM: te nana mainenu na hie ho yofna?
o’a mo yaa cmʉcmʉ ta engʉca, cu espayo ta congeoha.
S.TRANSL: 天空沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky; the stars came out.

S.FORM: mo mainenu co hie ta yafana?
micu tosvo mʉchʉ, cu espayo si hie, ho yuyafo ta hioyu.
S.TRANSL: 雨剛剛停，出了太陽，彩虹出來了。
The rain has just stopped, the sun has come out, the rainbow is coming out.

S.FORM: mio mainenu na hie no imu yoni?

S.TRANSL: We're going to have a big storm here.

S.FORM: mio ʉmnʉ na hie no iko yoni?
mio na’no ʉmnʉ, mo yuyafo ta hie.
S.TRANSL: Very well, out of the big sun.
I have to go to school.

S.FORM: mo na’no soyʉmʉ ’e hie,mateoskopʉ no yʉsʉ.
S.TRANSL: The weather is very cold, so wear more clothes.

S.FORM: tenac’u smʉnʉ’ʉ, teko talua mahafo to oyofnga.
S.TRANSL: 等一下會下大雨，你要記得帶傘。
It's going to rain heavily, you have to remember to bring an umbrella.

S.FORM: mo muni ’o ak’e engʉca, tena ahtuo’te mʉchʉ.
S.TRANSL: 剛剛打雷了，等一下應該就會下雨。
There was thunder just now, and it's supposed to rain later.
剛剛有下雨，現在雨停了。
It just rained, and now it's stopped.

S.FORM: mais’a moso cu mʉchʉ, mo noe’ʉcʉ ’e ceonʉ.
S.TRANSL: 好像下過雨了，馬路是濕的。
It seems to have rained and the road is wet.

S.FORM: mio mʉchʉ? mainci aucunu noe’ʉcʉ si feangosu?
S.TRANSL: 有下雨嗎?你怎麼全身都濕了?
Is it raining? Why are you all wet?

S.FORM: mo mʉchʉ si yafana, mo’u ta’payo’ʉ maafo to oyofnga.
S.TRANSL: 外面在下雨，我沒有帶雨傘。
It's raining outside, so I didn't bring an umbrella.

S.FORM: mo na’no poepe, anga ta’poepza cu congo co fnguu’u.
S.TRANSL: The wind is blowing so hard that my head hurts.

S.FORM: mo na’no cong’e hie, anga hioza cu moyomo co fnguu’u.
S.TRANSL: 太陽好大，曬得我頭好暈。
The sun is so big, it makes me dizzy.
I forgot to bring my pen.
I forgot to bring my chopsticks.

S.FORM: o’a mi’os’a h’unano maafo, teto no mhino.
S.TRANSL: I don't have one either, let's go buy one.
Let's go buy a pen, shall we?
Well, I still have to buy erasers.
No, I've already eaten at home.
I forgot to steam my lunchbox.
I forgot to bring my lunchbox.
那我們一起吃我的便當吧!
Then let's eat my lunch box together!

S.FORM: cuma na tako ana ho cohzona?
S.TRANSL: What are you having for lunch?

S.FORM: cuma na tako ana ho cohiona?

S.TRANSL: 我要吃學校的營養午餐。
I want a nutritious school lunch.

S.FORM: cuma na tako ana ho cohzona?
S.TRANSL: What are you having for lunch?

S.FORM: mi’o maafo to cʉyʉ maitan’e, tato opoepohʉ ho cohzona.
S.TRANSL: 我今天有帶便當，我們中午一起吃吧!
I've brought a lunchbox today, let's eat together at noon!

S.FORM: teto eno peispak’i to lankiu. zou?
S.TRANSL: Let's go play basketball, shall we?

S.FORM: teto eno eobako to yakiu, zou?
S.TRANSL: Let's go play baseball, shall we?

S.FORM: tekon’a yaa si si’ngi ho faeni a’o.
S.TRANSL: Please help me with the broom.

S.FORM: zou, ’e si’ngi eni te’o faeni suu.
S.TRANSL: Okay, here's a broomstick for you.
Can you help me with the cloth?

S.FORM: mi’on’a tusi’ngi, poa yaeni ta voyu.
S.TRANSL: I'm sweeping the floor, you ask voyu to help you.

S.FORM: na’no ca’i si la p’ep’ecihi, naho no pahisin’a.
S.TRANSL: The floor is dirty, go clean it.

S.FORM: mo na’no ca’i ta pethʉ’ta, pahisin’a.
S.TRANSL: 那個窗戶很髒，去擦一下。
That window is very dirty, go clean it.
等一下，我還沒掃完這裡。
Wait a minute, I'm not done sweeping here yet.
I'm going to see my teacher.

S.FORM: cuma na tako hioa ho tac’u tosvo tmopsʉ?
S.TRANSL: What do you do after school?

S.FORM: ta’u fiho to nanghia’u ho pasunaeno.
S.TRANSL: I'm going to sing with my friends.

S.FORM: cuma na tasi hioa ho tac’u tosvo tmopsʉ?
tuocosi na’a mio yonta emoo ’o yangui?

S.TRANSL: She’s at home, please come in.

S.FORM: o’amos’a yontan’e, cuma na teko hioa?
S.TRANSL: 她不在，請問你有什麼事?
She's not here, what can I do for you?

S.FORM: ak’i, ’a paicʉ a’o, paavin’a si phingi.
S.TRANSL: Grandpa, I'm paic_289, please open the door.

S.FORM: apu’u, ’a paicʉ a’o, te’o i’eima suu ho peispak’i.
S.TRANSL: apu'u, I'm pacic_289 and I've come to play with you.

S.FORM: zou eno! os’o na’na talua na suu, aupcio uhtan’e teto ya’ei.
S.TRANSL: 是啊!我很想念你。快來聊天吧!
Yeah! I miss you so much. Come on, let's chat!
Please sit down and have some tea.
好喔!這些水果看起來很棒。

S.FORM: mio, mo a’ ʉmtʉ na’no mafe.
micu toecuyu to oyofna ’o ino, naho cu aupcio uhtan’e ho bonʉ!
S.TRANSL: 媽媽煮好晚餐了，快來吃吧!
Mom has cooked dinner, come and eat!
Okay, I'll go wash my hands.

S.FORM: ooyoseʉ’sio, zou eno mocmo na suu.
S.TRANSL: 盡量吃喝，你又不是外人。
Try to eat and drink as much as possible, you're not an outsider.

S.FORM: micu angu man’i ’o os’o ana, cu oenguzu.
S.TRANSL: I ate a lot, I'm full.

S.FORM: te’ocu mongoi, ta’u la i’vaho uhtan’e ho aiti suu.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開了，下次再來看你。
I'm leaving, I'll see you next time.

S.FORM: micu angu yofna, te’o cu maine’e.
zou, uhne emoo’u hociko la meemelʉ.
S.TRANSL: Okay, come to my house sometime.

S.FORM: acʉhʉ ʉmnʉ, maitan’e te hafa ta lema’cohio ho uhto you ho tuhtuucosʉ to mamameoi.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，老師今天要帶大家去部落訪問耆老。
Hello everyone, today I’m taking you to the tribe to interview the elders.

S.FORM: na’no ʉmnʉ, teto uhto mamameoi ho bua cou.
S.TRANSL: 好喔!我們要跟耆老說鄒語。
Okay! We’re going to speak Chowder with the seniors.

S.FORM: ak’i, mimza uhtan’e ho aiti suu.
S.TRANSL: Grandpa, we’ve come to see you.

S.FORM: ’oaa! ma mimu meelʉ bua cou! a’ʉmtʉ na’no ʉmnʉ!
S.TRANSL: 哇! 你們會說鄒語啊!真是太棒了!
Wow! You speak the Tsou language! That’s great!

S.FORM: acʉhʉ ʉmnʉ, maitan’e te hafa ta lema’cohio ho uhto toton’u ho yaahioa.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，老師今天要帶大家去小米田工作。
Hello everyone, today I will take you to work in the millet field.

S.FORM: acʉhʉ uhtan’e ho bitoyange, talʉa hafa ’o te tititha.
S.TRANSL: 大家過來排隊，記得帶好工具。
Come and line up, remember to bring your tools.

S.FORM: zou, lema’cohio, imza cu acʉha hafa ’ete tititha.
S.TRANSL: 是的，老師，我們都拿好工具了。
Yes, sir, we’ve got our tools.
Not yet, it’s still far away.
You go get the bird catcher.
Okay, I’ll go and catch the birds.

S.FORM: acʉhʉ ʉmnʉ, teto uhto emoo no mayuyuansou maitan’e.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，我們今天要去動物園。
Hello everyone, we are going to the zoo today.

S.FORM: na’no ʉmnʉ, teto mainenu hote uhne’e?
S.TRANSL: 好棒喔!我們要怎麼去呢?
Awesome! How are we going to get there?

S.FORM: acʉhʉ bitoyange, teto ayocʉ mhia kipu.
S.TRANSL: 大家排好隊，我們準備買票。
Everyone line up, we are ready to buy tickets.

S.FORM: zou mazozomʉ sica, zou mafkofkoi ta’e. acʉhʉ iachi bobaito.
S.TRANSL: 前面是鳥類，後面是蛇類，大家自己參觀。
There are birds in the front and snakes in the back.
It doesn’t matter, then you go and watch the birds.
我們一個小時後回來集合。
We’ll be back in an hour.

S.FORM: zou cuma na iko aiti maitan’e?
mo man’i ’o os’o aiti ci fkoi. ho ma’i ’o zomʉ.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了好多蛇，還有好多鳥。
I saw a lot of snakes and a lot of birds.
Hurry up, we have to go.

S.FORM: totea na’a a’o, mo ngoseo co t’ango’u.
S.TRANSL: Wait for me, my feet are tired.
There are a lot of people swimming here.

S.FORM: mo na’no fozu ta chumu ta’e, tetoc’o yontan’e ho yuuhnguzu.
S.TRANSL: 那裡水很深，我們在這裡游泳就好。
The water is deep there, so we just swim here.
What kind of car did you take?
How do you go to church?

S.FORM: mo ’uten to kuyai ’o amo ho hafa a’o.

S.TRANSL: How does he usually go to school?

S.FORM: la nooyo to cieyʉn ho toatmopsx.
S.TRANSL: He took the subway to school.

S.FORM: la buacuma hola mhia chae ’o ba’isu?
S.TRANSL: How does your grandmother go to the grocery store?
She went to the grocery store on a motorcycle.
How are you going to get to Orchid Island?
I want to take a boat to Lanyu.
How did he get to Orchid Island?

S.FORM: mita yonto hikooki ho uhne lanyi.
S.TRANSL: He took a plane to Orchid Island.

S.FORM: cuma na ita yoni ho uhne takao?
S.TRANSL: What bus did he take to Kaohsiung?

S.FORM: mita yonto kaothie ho uhne takao.
S.TRANSL: He took the THSR to Kaohsiung.

S.FORM: mita yono kuyai no yaa puzu ho uhne taitoo?
S.TRANSL: Did he take a train to Taitung?

S.FORM: zou, ’a mita yonto kuyai no yaa puzu ho uhne taitoo.
S.TRANSL: Yes, he took a train to Taitung.

S.FORM: mita yono kuyai no yaa puzu ho uhne taitoo?
S.TRANSL: Did he take a train to Taitung?

S.FORM: o’a, ’a mita yonto hikooki ho uhne taitoo.
S.TRANSL: No, he took a plane to Taitung.
Is there a bus stop near here?
有，往前走就會看到公車站了。
Yes, if you go straight ahead, you will see the bus stop.

S.FORM: mo yonenu namo atva’esi cum’u ci cieyʉn tan’e?
S.TRANSL: 離這裡最近的捷運站在哪裡?
Where is the nearest MRT station?

S.FORM: uk’a cis’a cieyʉn tan’e, tekoc’o yonto haiya.
S.TRANSL: 這裡沒有捷運站，你只能坐計程車。
There is no MRT station here, you can only take a taxi.

S.FORM: te mainenu na hia nona’o no vasu hocic’u sʉc’ʉhʉ ne ’oyonatmopsʉ?
S.TRANSL: How long does it take to get to the school by bus?

S.FORM: te mainenu na hia nona’o no kaothie hoci uhne thaiciu?
S.TRANSL: 搭高鐵要多久時間會到臺中?
How long does it take to get to Taichung by THSR?

S.FORM: tec’o cono masconi tac’u sʉc’ʉhʉ ne thaiciu.
S.TRANSL: I will come to Taichung in an hour.

S.FORM: tee noana’o hoci ’unten no kuyai ho uhne ’ulai?
S.TRANSL: Is it a long drive to Ulai?

S.FORM: te mainenu na hia nona’o honciko yono cieyʉn ho uhta emoo’u?
S.TRANSL: 你搭捷運來我家要多久?
How long did it take you to come to my house by subway?
Do you know how to ride a bicycle?

S.FORM: o’ate, o’amos’a man’i na os’o co’cohivi.
S.TRANSL: Don't, I don't know much about it.

S.FORM: teko meemelʉ ho atavei no cohzona? teko tiova honci’u usa ho aiti na suu?
S.TRANSL: 你下午有空嗎?我想去拜訪你可以嗎?
Are you free this afternoon? I'd like to visit you, is that okay?

S.FORM: naho, ta’u yonta emoo ho totea na suu.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I'll wait for you at home.

S.FORM: tako meemelʉ ho hucma? nte’o mici tuucocosʉ suu no h’oehanva ta cou a’toana.
S.TRANSL: 你明天有空嗎?我想請問你關於鄒族的傳說故事。
Are you free tomorrow? I'd like to ask you about the legendary story of the Tsou people.

S.FORM: ta’u uhne fuengu ho hucma, o’a ta’us’a yonta emoo.
S.TRANSL: 明天我要去山上，不在家喔。
I'm going to the mountains tomorrow, so I won't be home.

S.FORM: o’u totalʉi ho leako na’no bocbochio tola hia h’ocoecona ta cou ne noan’o, mi’o mici tuucocosʉ suu.
S.TRANSL: 我聽說您對鄒族的傳統習俗非常了解，想要請教您一下。
I've heard that you know a lot about the traditional customs of the Tsou people, so I'd like to ask you a few questions.

S.FORM: o’a mos’a man’i na os’o co’cohivi, at’inghi ta’u pnanfi ho eʉsvʉsvʉta.
S.TRANSL: 我所了解的不多，但是我會盡量回答。
I don't know much about it, but I will try to answer as best I can.

S.FORM: te’o tuocosʉn’a, te’o peela hu’ongki? tenala ko’ko peela ʉmnʉ ci tpotposi.
S.TRANSL: 請問我可以錄影嗎?這樣以後比較容易記錄。
Can I record the video? It will be easier to record in the future.

S.FORM: miko cu topzoha ta tonsoha maitan’e?
zou maezo cou a’toana na vcongʉsu?
S.TRANSL: 請問您的太太也是鄒族嗎?
Is your wife also a Chow?

S.FORM: mo pio ci h’oe’ea na lako peelʉi?
la’u meelʉ bua cou ho bua sbukunu.
S.TRANSL: I speak the Tsou and Bunun languages.

S.FORM: na’no kaebʉ ho os’o tuucocosi suu maitan’e, tekon’a eʉsvʉta, nala peesi hola e’ohʉ ea fou zou?
S.TRANSL: 今天很高興能訪問您，請您談一下，有關狩獵的禁忌好嗎?
It's a pleasure to interview you today, can you talk about the taboo of hunting?

S.FORM: ateno mo’u la na’nosino uhne fuengu ho ea fou ne mo’un’a foinana.
S.TRANSL: 好的。我年輕的時候很常上山打獵。
Yes. I used to go hunting in the mountains when I was young.

S.FORM: ’aveoveoyʉ , a’ʉmtʉ na’no ʉmnʉ ’e iko pa’cohivneni maitan’e.
S.TRANSL: 謝謝，您今天所教導的真是太棒了。
Thank you, what you taught me today was really great.

S.FORM: i’e os’o eʉsvʉsvʉta maitan’e mo a’ʉmtu emzo, ohela h’oehanva to niala acngicngihi maameoi.
S.TRANSL: 我所説的都是千真萬確的，祖先所流傳的講述。
All that I say is true, the sayings of my ancestors.

S.FORM: tec’o ec’ʉhʉ tan’e na’no ’aveoveoyʉ ta iko eʉsvʉsvʉta.
S.TRANSL: 今天的訪談就到這邊。非常謝謝您的分享。
That's all for today's interview. Thank you very much for sharing with us.

S.FORM: te’o cu mongoi, tata’za honcila i’vaho tmalʉ no man’i ci ehohanvasu.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開了，期待下次聽到你更多的故事。
I'm going to leave now and look forward to hearing more of your story next time.
Welcome, what do you want to buy?
I want to buy a cup.
Welcome, what do you want to buy?
I want to buy a hat.

S.FORM: te’o mhia soetohva, pano imu phieni?
S.TRANSL: 我要買杯子，你們有賣嗎?
I want to buy a cup, do you sell them?

S.FORM: panto, tee pio na teko phini?
S.TRANSL: Yes, how many do you want to buy?

S.FORM: uk’as’a, o’a lamzas’a mhino no fi’i.
S.TRANSL: No, we don't sell betel nut.

S.FORM: tee pio no efucu na teko phini?
S.TRANSL: How many packs do you want to buy?

S.FORM: poa tuyu no cfua ho faeni a’o.

S.TRANSL: I want to buy sweet potatoes.
All the sweet potatoes are sold out.

S.FORM: te’o mhia yusno pania ci hʉsʉ.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy two bottles of oil.

S.FORM: te pio no kinkina na teko phini?
S.TRANSL: How many pounds do you want to buy?

S.FORM: te pio no kinkina na teko phini ci fcuyu?
S.TRANSL: How many pounds of eggs do you want to buy?
I want to buy two catties.

S.FORM: te’o mhia yusno peongu ci nengi.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy two green onions.

S.FORM: micuc’o tuno peongu, naho acuha yaa.
S.TRANSL: There are three left, all for you!

S.FORM: isi supzoi ’emo cono cfua ci fʉesʉ?
S.TRANSL: How much is this bag of rice?

S.FORM: mo acʉhʉ sumpusku ucni, tec’o poa sumpusku.

S.TRANSL: I'll buy some more, and make up 100 yuan.

S.FORM: mo angu pepe eni, tee peela ake’a poa cʉecʉ?
S.TRANSL: 這個太貴了，可以算便宜一點嗎?
It's too expensive, can you make it cheaper?

S.FORM: o’a tes’a, ’a micu na’no cuecʉ na eni.
S.TRANSL: 不行，這個已經很便宜了。
No, this is already very cheap.

S.FORM: te’o phini ’emo cono cfua ci kamcia.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy this packet of cookies.

S.FORM: mo sumtueha, pano tekon’a ’ucea yaa ci macucuma?
S.TRANSL: 這餅乾30元，還需要別的東西嗎?
$30 for the cookies, anything else you need?
Can I borrow money from you?

S.FORM: tenokuzo te pio na teko ’ucea yuevaha?
S.TRANSL: Yes! How much do you need?

S.FORM: mi’o ta’payo’ʉ maafo to peisu, te’o meelʉ yuevaho suu?
S.TRANSL: 我忘記帶錢了，我可以跟你借錢嗎?
I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

S.FORM: mi’o maezo o’te mahafo no peisu!
S.TRANSL: I don't have any money either!

S.FORM: mi’o ta’payo’ʉ mahno peisu, te’o meelʉ yuevaho suu?
S.TRANSL: 我忘記帶錢了，我可以跟你借錢嗎?
I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

S.FORM: o’ate’o,’amcu osko yooveia ’o osu aueva yuevaha ci peisu.
S.TRANSL: 不要，上次借的錢你都還沒還我。
No, you haven't paid me back the money you borrowed last time.

S.FORM: tekon’a yuevahahneni a’o si zitensasu, zou?
S.TRANSL: 請借給我你的腳踏車,好嗎?
Can I borrow your bicycle, please?

S.FORM: naho, at’inghi tako yooveineni ho hucma.
S.TRANSL: Okay, but you have to give it back to me tomorrow.

S.FORM: cu mʉchʉ, mi’o o’te mahafo no oyofnga, poan’a yuevaho ta oyofngasu zou?
S.TRANSL: 下雨了，我沒有帶傘，借我傘好嗎?
It's raining, I don't have an umbrella, can you lend me one?

S.FORM: moc’o coni ’e oyofnga’u, teto ipoepohʉ oefʉngʉ.
S.TRANSL: 我只有一把傘，我們一起撐吧!
I only have an umbrella, let's stick together!

S.FORM: eni ’o o’u yuevaha suu ci tposʉ, cu yooveineni suu.
S.TRANSL: 這是你上次借我的書，還給你。
This is the book you borrowed from me last time, I give it back to you.

S.FORM: tako eʉsvʉta a’o na iko ’ucea aiti ci tposʉ.
S.TRANSL: 你還想看什麼書都可以跟我說。
You can tell me what else you want to read.

S.FORM: te’o yooveineni suu ho homna ’e os’o yuevaha ci peisu?
S.TRANSL: When do I have to pay you back?

S.FORM: ’upena, takola yoovei hociko cula yaa peisu.
S.TRANSL: 沒關係，你有錢的時候再說。
It doesn't matter, you can talk about it when you have money.

S.FORM: tako yoovei ho homna ’o osula yuevaha ci peisu?
S.TRANSL: When are you going to pay me back?
I will return it to you tomorrow.

S.FORM: tako yoovei ho homna ’o osula yuevaha ci tposʉ?
S.TRANSL: When are you going to return my book?

S.FORM: ’a o’ucu eno yooveineni suu ne hucma?
S.TRANSL: 我昨天不是已經還你了嗎?
Didn't I return it to you yesterday?

S.FORM: osi yuevahneni suu to yavai ’e ’oyomzana tmopsʉ eni?
S.TRANSL: Did yavai lend you this pen?
Yes, I borrowed it from him today.

S.FORM: osu yuevaha to pasuya ’e ’oyomzana tmopsʉ eni?
S.TRANSL: Did you borrow this pen from Pasuya?
No, this is what mom bought.

S.FORM: micu uk’ana siu, uhto paicʉ ho ake’i yuevaho.
S.TRANSL: We are out of salt, so let's go borrow some from Paic.

S.FORM: usa ’o yangui ho poa yooveineni ’o osi yuevaha ci peisu.
S.TRANSL: Go and ask yangui to return my money.

S.FORM: mo pio na osi yuevaha suu ci peisu?
S.TRANSL: How much does she owe you?

S.FORM: te’o uhne chachae ho emʉm’ʉ to chae.
S.TRANSL: I’m going to plant vegetables in the garden.

S.FORM: mo na’no kukuzo, mi’on’a tmuvci, ta’u aopha’o cohmo to chumu.
S.TRANSL: 草太多了，我在砍草，等一下要澆水。
There's too much grass, I'm cutting it, I'll have to water it later.

S.FORM: teko’na yaa ’o poyave no kosʉ ho tu’u ho faeni a’o zou?
S.TRANSL: 幫我把鐮刀和鋤頭拿來好嗎?
Will you get my scythes and hoes, please?

S.FORM: sia to chipi to kosʉ no ef’ongʉ.
S.TRANSL: Put it next to the plow rake.
Did you turn over the soil?

S.FORM: o’un’a mihna ef’onga, aomane tac’u yapi.
S.TRANSL: 我剛翻過土，等等要播種。
I just turned over the soil, and so on to sow seeds.

S.FORM: tec’u toc’ʉha ’o osu emu’a ci chae?
S.TRANSL: 你種的菜可以收成了嗎?
Are your vegetables ready to be harvested?

S.FORM: ’a tec’u toc’ʉha ’e kiavecu tan’e, o’a mocu te toc’ʉha ta tahza ta’e.
S.TRANSL: 這裡的高麗菜可以收成了，那裡的昭和草就還不能收成。
The cabbage here is ready to be harvested, but the Showa grass there is not yet ready to be harvested.

S.FORM: ’uaa! ci na’no man’i ’e osko pa’ea ci f’ue.
S.TRANSL: 哇!你挖了這麼多的地瓜。
(sighs) Wow! You dug up so many gourds.

S.FORM: to’usni a’o ho sia to ketbʉ.
S.TRANSL: Will you help me with the barn?

S.FORM: mimza mosi ta yungu ho ea yoskʉ.
S.TRANSL: We're releasing fishing nets to catch fish.
魚簍裡已經抓了很多魚。
The fish basket has been full of fish.

S.FORM: leako buacuma ho tʉtpʉtʉ no yoskʉ?
S.TRANSL: How do you usually catch fish?

S.FORM: la’u boemi to teezo ho papteezoya ’o yaskʉ.
S.TRANSL: I shoot fish with a spear.

S.FORM: leako meelʉ titho to yanosuyu ho ea fou?
S.TRANSL: Do you know how to hunt with a bow and arrow?

S.FORM: la’u no’nosino titho to smohfihci ho tʉtpʉtʉ to yuansou, aasvʉtʉ titho to fuyu ho poa’av’u.
S.TRANSL: 我通常都是用陷阱抓獵物，偶爾也會拿槍帶狗狩獵。
I usually catch my prey with a trap, but occasionally I hunt with a gun and a dog.
This is the road the boar took.

S.FORM: ’a caphu no fuzu eni, ko’ko eno zou ceonʉ no fuzu eni.
S.TRANSL: 這是山豬的腳印，所以這是山豬所走的路。
These are the footprints of the boar, so this is the path the boar took.

S.FORM: aupcieva usa ho aiti ’o smohfihci, mais’a pano micu mumzo ci yuansou.
S.TRANSL: 快去看我們的陷阱，好像抓到獵物了。
Go and see our trap, for it seems that we have caught our prey.

S.FORM: mais’a isi elʉi ta av’u, teto aupcieva fihi ho aiti.
S.TRANSL: 狗好像聞到味道了。我們快跟過去。
The dog seems to have smelled it. Let's follow them.

S.FORM: zou macucuma no cuma si iko teoteai?
S.TRANSL: 你正在製作的是什麼東西?

S.FORM: ’a cʉfʉ no fatu, te titha tocʉfʉ to buhci.
S.TRANSL: 這是石壓式陷阱，用來抓老鼠的。
This is a stone trap, used to catch rats.

S.FORM: zou cuma ta iko sia ta’e ci ma’maica?
S.TRANSL: 你放在那裡的是什麼東西?
What is that thing you put there?

S.FORM: ’a h’oepona no buofeo’isi, lamza titha tʉtpʉtʉ to ta’cʉ.
S.TRANSL: 那是套腳式繩索陷阱，我們用它來抓山羌。
It was a leg-rigged rope trap, and we used it to catch Shankiang.

S.FORM: ’aveoveoyʉ no ak’e mameoi ho isi fii nomo ʉmnʉ ci piipia, na’no man’i ’e ito elʉa ci fou maitan’e.
S.TRANSL: 感謝祖靈賜福，今天我們有很多獵物收獲。
Thanks to the blessing of our ancestors, we had a great harvest today.

S.FORM: ’a zou eno, teto hafa maine’e ho aangangaeza to you.
S.TRANSL: 是啊!我們帶回部落好好分享吧!
Yeah! Let's take it back to the tribe and share it!

S.FORM: maitan’e te’o pa’cohivi muu ho bua cou na pat’ausna no mayuyuansou.
S.TRANSL: 今天我要教大家動物的鄒語怎麼說。
I will teach everyone all kinds of animals in Cou language today.

S.FORM: maitan’e te’o pa’cohivi muu ho bua cou na pat’ausna no ma’e’evi ho heʉm’ʉ.
S.TRANSL: 今天我要教大家植物的鄒語怎麼說。

S.FORM: maitan’e te’o pa’cohivi muu ho bua cou na pat’ausna no mav’ov’o ci mabeobeahci
S.TRANSL: 今天我要教大家水果的鄒語怎麼說。
I will teach everyone all kinds of fruits in Cou language today.

S.FORM: nahocu sia si iko tititha tmopsʉ.
zou nuu no sia ’e la titha tmopsʉ.
zou yʉsʉ to pasuya na eni?

S.TRANSL: Teacher, I didn’t bring my textbook.
Share the book with your classmate next to you.
I will lend you my eraser.
我們要下課了，回家路上要小心!
It is the end of the class, be careful on your way home.

S.FORM: te ac’ʉhʉ tan’e tetocu tosvo ho yupevai, yokeoasu.
S.TRANSL: 我們要下課了，大家再見。
The class is over, goodbye everyone.
Hello everyone, my name is pasuya.
Hello everyone, my name is voyu.

S.FORM: ohaesa to pasuya a’o, yangui ’o ongko’u.
S.TRANSL: 我是pasuya的妹妹，我的名字是yangui。
I am pasuya’s sister. My name is yangui.
What is your elder sister’s name?
My elder sister’s name is apu’u.
What is your younger sister’s name?
My younger sister’s name is naa’u.
How old is your elder brother?
How old is your younger brother?

S.FORM: pano leyoni ma’cohio to hosa muu?
S.TRANSL: Do you have schools in your community?
你在部落的學校讀書嗎?
Do you study in your tribe’s school?

S.FORM: ’a lea’u, lamza mais’a cono emoo ho lamza noteuyunu tmopsʉ.
S.TRANSL: 是的，在學校讀書我們像一家人。
Yes, we are like family while we are studying at school.

S.FORM: cuma na lasi hioa to inosu?
S.TRANSL: 你的媽媽從事什麼工作?

S.FORM: cuma na lasi hioa to amosu?
S.TRANSL: 你的爸爸從事什麼工作?
不是， 他是我弟弟的朋友。
No, he is my younger brother’s friend.
不是， 她是我的妹妹。
No, she is my younger sister.

S.FORM: mo pio na mihin’i cono emoo?
S.TRANSL: How many people in their family?
There are five people in their family.
How many children in your family?
There are four children in our family.
How many younger siblings do you have?

S.FORM: uk’a hahocngʉ, mo tuyu ci maamespingi.
S.TRANSL: 我沒有弟弟，有三位妹妹。
I don’t have any younger brothers, but I have three younger sisters.
How many older siblings do you have?
I don’t have any older siblings.
How many siblings do you have?
是的， 她也是鄒族人。

S.FORM: mo ake’i coheʉceʉ, la asngʉcʉ mimo tomo noyano ci chumu.
S.TRANSL: 天氣有點冷，要多喝熱水。
It’s a bit cold, so you need to drink more warm water.

S.FORM: mo ake’i mu’ei, la asngʉcʉ mimo to chumu.
S.TRANSL: It’s a bit hot, so you need to drink more water.

S.FORM: mo molʉ ho mu’ei, buo’te poa hiozneni.
S.TRANSL: The sun is bright and remember to wear sunscreen.

S.FORM: mo na’no mvʉecʉ, cu uk’a na hie.
S.TRANSL: There are a lot of clouds but no sun in the sky.

S.FORM: te nana mainenu na hpʉhpʉngʉ ho hucma?

S.TRANSL: It will be cloudy and windy but not sunny tomorrow.
How was the weather that day?

S.FORM: mo ake’i soyʉmʉ maitan’e, sʉ’eʉsʉ no mo noyano.
S.TRANSL: 這天有點冷，出門要穿外套。
It was a bit cold and you needed to wear a jacket when you went outside.
How’s the weather on the weekend?
It will be sunny on the weekend.
Will it be rainy that day?
那天天氣晴朗，不會下雨。
It will have no rain and be sunny that day.
Will it be rainy that day?
Yes, it will be rainy that day.

S.FORM: micu tosvo, cu yuyafo ta hie.
S.TRANSL: The rain stops and the sun comes out.

S.FORM: mo mʉchʉ, o’a mi’o mahno khasa.
S.TRANSL: It is raining and I don’t have an umbrella with me.

S.FORM: o’a, ’a tena smuvaho no ta’esi cohzona, mahno khasa.
S.TRANSL: 現在沒有下雨，中午過後會下雨，出門要帶傘。
It is not raining now, but it will be rainy in the afternoon, so you need to bring an umbrella when you go out.
Will it be very cold in winter next year?

S.FORM: ’a tee, te nana na’no soyʉmʉ, te mateonoyano.
S.TRANSL: 是，明年冬天會很冷，要穿很多衣服。
Yes, it will be very cold in winter next year, so you need to put on extra layers.

S.FORM: te nana na’no mu’ei ta tonsoha maitan’e?
S.TRANSL: Will it be very hot in summer this year?

S.FORM: ’a tee, te nana na’no mu’ei ho tenac’u homu’eina, la asngʉcʉ mimo to chumu.
S.TRANSL: 是，夏天會很熱，要多喝水。
Yes, it will be very hot and you need to drink more water.

S.FORM: ’a os’o kaebʉa ho mo hofungahoa, o’a mo na’no mu’ei.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡春天，天氣很溫暖。
I like spring because the weather is warm.

S.FORM: o’a, la’so man’i ’o cmoehu ho mio.
S.TRANSL: I don’t like autumn because there are lots of typhoons in autumn.
I forgot to bring the textbook.
I will share it with you.
I forgot to bring the eraser.
Do you forget to bring your pen?
Yes, can you lend me a pen?

S.FORM: teko bonʉ no cuma ho cohzona?
S.TRANSL: What would you like for lunch?

S.FORM: teko bonʉ no cuma ho yofna?
S.TRANSL: What would you like for dinner?

S.FORM: cuma na osu ana ne taseona?
S.TRANSL: What did you have for breakfast?

S.FORM: cuma na osu ana ne cohzona?
S.TRANSL: What did you have for lunch?
你先去，我等一下去找你。
You go first and I will catch up later.

S.FORM: o’a te, teto teopoya n’a ’o matpotposʉ.
S.TRANSL: No, we have to carry books first.

S.FORM: o’a mocu, os’o n’a tonzou to takubingi.
S.TRANSL: Not yet. I am doing the dishes.
Why didn’t you wash your hands?
I will wash my hands later.

S.FORM: cuma na osu hioa ne soni?
S.TRANSL: What were you doing just now?
I went to meet the teacher.

S.FORM: cuma na tako hioa ho takocu aepʉngʉ tmopsʉ maitan’e?
S.TRANSL: What are you going to do after school?

S.FORM: cuma na tata hioa ho tatacu aepʉngʉ tmopsʉ maitan’e?
S.TRANSL: What is she doing after school?
She is going to go dancing.

S.FORM: o’a mo’so yonta emoo ’o tanivu! ’a yangui a’o, pano nteko? ta’u evaha to tanivu ho tac’u yuovei.
S.TRANSL: tanivu不在家耶!我是yangui，有什麼事嗎? 回來我會轉告tanivu。
tanivu is not at home. I am yangui. What can I do for you? I will let him know when he comes back.

S.FORM: ba’i, ’a yangui ho tanivu a’mi, maavo n’a ta phingi!
S.TRANSL: 奶奶，我們是yangui和tanivu，幫我們開門!
Grandma, we are yangui and tanivu, please open the door for us.

S.FORM: ’a pasuya a’o, te’o miebini to mo’o.
S.TRANSL: I am pasuya, I am here for mo’o.

S.FORM: ba’i, mi’o esmi ho aopa’to suu.
S.TRANSL: Grandma, I am here to see you.

S.FORM: mikocu noana’o o’te uh tan’e, engha na’na talʉa na suu.
S.TRANSL: 你好久沒來了，我好想念你。
You haven’t been here for a long time. I missed you so much.

S.FORM: tanivu, mi’o miebini suu ho mici peispak’i.
S.TRANSL: tanivu, I am here to play with you.

S.FORM: aupcio yʉmeʉmʉ, os’o aoka tote na suu.
S.TRANSL: Come on in! I have been waiting for you for a long time.

S.FORM: ’e os’o iachia emʉ’a ci f’ue, othoma.
S.TRANSL: 這是我種的地瓜，吃吃看。
This is the sweet potato I grow. Try it!
The sweet potato is so sweet.

S.FORM: uh tan’e, othoma ’e os’o iachia emʉ’a ci beahci no ana.
S.TRANSL: 過來，這是我種的水果，吃看看。
Come here! These are the fruits I grow. You should try it.

S.FORM: yusuhngu! othoma ’e os’o emʉ’a ci pohe.
S.TRANSL: 請坐！這是我種的有機玉米吃看看。
Take a seat! You should try some organic corn that I grow.
Wow! The corn tastes so sweet.

S.FORM: o’a la’u ʉmnʉ to huv’o, te’o bonʉ to linggo.
S.TRANSL: 我不能吃橘子，我吃蘋果就好。
I can’t eat oranges. I will have some apples instead.
Sure, I like it very much.

S.FORM: te’o s’eapucusi ’e te’o p’aeni ci beahci.
S.TRANSL: Let me peel the fruit for you.
Thank you. This fruit is so juicy.

S.FORM: te’o mayo to chumu no teko ima.
S.TRANSL: I will bring you some water.
Enjoy yourself. I cooked a lot of dishes.
Oh! It smells good and looks delicious.
Enjoy yourself. There is a lot more.
I’ll make myself at home then.
Enjoy yourself. There are plenty here.
我吃了好多，不能再吃了。
I ate a lot and couldn’t eat any more.

S.FORM: te’o hafa uhne fuengu na muu maitan’e.
S.TRANSL: 老師今天要帶你們去山上。
I will take you to the mountains today.

S.FORM: isi yangca to ino mo man’i ’o mo’eocʉ.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽說山上有很多蚊子。
Mom says that there are lots of mosquitoes in the mountains.

S.FORM: te’o hafa uh ne chana na muu maitan’e.
S.TRANSL: 老師今天要帶你們去田裡。
I will take you to the fields.
Are we going to loosen the soil?

S.FORM: tesi hafa uhne c’oeha to lema’cohio.
S.TRANSL: Teacher will take us to the riverside.

S.FORM: tesi hafa uh ne fuengu to lema’cohio.
S.TRANSL: Teacher will take us to the mountains today.
Are we going to the riverside today?

S.FORM: o’a, tesi hafa uh ne fuengu to lema’cohio.
S.TRANSL: 不是，老師要帶我們去山上。
No, our teacher is going to take us to the mountains.
Are we going to the mountains today?

S.FORM: o’a, teto uh ne chana maitan’e.
S.TRANSL: 不是，我們今天要去田裡。
No, we are going to the fields.

S.FORM: lema’cohio, cuma teto aiti ho teto uh ne c’oeha?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我們到河邊要看什麼?
Teacher, what are we going to see at the riverside?
We are going to see dragonflies.

S.FORM: lema’cohio, cuma teto aiti ho teto uh ne fuengu?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我們到山上要看什麼?
Teacher, what are we going to see in the mountains?

S.FORM: teto uh ne’e ho baito to tokeuya.
S.TRANSL: We are going to see butterflies.

S.FORM: cuma teto hioa ho teto uh ne chana?
S.TRANSL: What are we going to do in the fields?

S.FORM: teto uh ne chana ho aiti ’o ito emʉ’a ci pohe, biu’i’io ’sio to sosea ho teongo.
S.TRANSL: 我們要到田裡看我們種的玉米，要小心有螞蟻、蜜蜂唷。
We are going to see the corn we grow in the fields, but you need to be aware of the ants and bees.

S.FORM: lema’cohio, teto yuhnguzu ho teto uh ne c’oeha?
S.TRANSL: 老師我們要到河邊游泳嗎?
Teacher, are we going to swim in the river?
No, we are going to see dragonflies.

S.FORM: lema’cohio, teto mʉemʉm’ʉ no chae ho teto uh ne chana?
S.TRANSL: 老師我們要到田裡種菜嗎?
Teacher, are we going to grow some vegetables in the fields?
We are going to loosen the soil today.

S.FORM: panto mo tohtoesoso ci tonvo ta’e.
mi’o petohʉyʉ baito ta mo yansou ci tonvo.
S.TRANSL: 我今天才看過真正活著的蜻蜓。
Today is the first time I see real living dragonflies.

S.FORM: ’a eno, la’u ʉmnʉa ’o tokeuya, mo ʉmnʉ ho isi aiti.
S.TRANSL: 耶！哇！我喜歡蝴蝶，很漂亮。
Yeh! Wow! I love butterflies. They are very beautiful.
Those are not butterflies. They are bees.
在這裡看一看，不要到太遠的地方唷!
Come here and take a look. Don’t go too far!
好，我們不會去太遠的地方。
Got it, we won’t go anywhere too far.

S.FORM: ’ote peayofʉ, apopoha’o c’o ci temu s’a smopcuku.
S.TRANSL: 不要用跑的，慢慢走免得跌倒了。
Don’t run and walk slowly lest you fall down.

S.FORM: mi’o cu tonsoyʉ no mieci baito.
S.TRANSL: I want to see them right away.

S.FORM: te mai na teko hia uh ne teova?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to the block-house?

S.FORM: te’o yonto kuyai ho uh ne teova.
te mai na teta hia uh ne veoing?
S.TRANSL: How does he go to the hospital?

S.FORM: teta coeconʉ ho uh ne veoing.
te mai na teko hia uh ne lanyi?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to Penghu?

S.FORM: la’u yonto hikooki ho uhne lanyi.
S.TRANSL: I go to Penghu by plane.

S.FORM: te mai na teko hia uh ne lanyi?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to Penghu?
I go to Penghu by boat.

S.FORM: te’o nooyo to kuyai no mayahe.
te yono cuma ’o apu’u ho te uh ne ’oyonatmopsʉ?
S.TRANSL: How does apu’u go to school?

S.FORM: te nooyo to kuyai no tacvo’hi ’o apu’u ho uh ne ’oyonatmopsʉ.
S.TRANSL: apu’u goes to school by train.

S.FORM: te yono cuma ’o pasuya ho te uh ne kiokai?
S.TRANSL: How does pasuya go to church?

S.FORM: te yonto zitensa ’o pasuya ho uh ne kiokai.
S.TRANSL: pasuya goes to church by bicycle.

S.FORM: lako yonto kuyai no mayahe ho uh ne ’oyonatmopsʉ?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to school by MRT?

S.FORM: o’a, mi’o nooyo to vasu ho uh ne ’oyonatmopsʉ.
S.TRANSL: No, I go to school by bus.

S.FORM: lako yonto zitensa ho uh ne ’oyonatmopsʉ?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to school by bicycle?

S.FORM: teno, la’u yonto zitensa ho uh ne ’oyonatmopsʉ.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I go to school by bicycle.

S.FORM: lako nooyo to kaothe ho lako uh ne kaoseong?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail?

S.FORM: teno, la’u nooyo to kuyai no smomacongo ho uh ne kaoseong.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail.

S.FORM: ho teko uh ne thaitong, nenusi na te mayahehe ’o kuyai ho hikoki?
S.TRANSL: 你去台東搭火車還是搭飛機?
Are you going to Taitung by train or by plane?

S.FORM: te’o nooyo to hikoki, mo mayahehe to kuyai ’o hikoki.
S.TRANSL: 我搭飛機，搭飛機比搭火車快。
I will take the plane because it is faster than the train.

S.FORM: teko nooyo no vasu hoci eno iachi poʉt’ʉcʉ no kuyai ho teko uh ne kiokai?
S.TRANSL: 你去教會搭公車還是開車?
Are you going to drive to the church or take the bus?

S.FORM: te’o iachi poʉt’ʉcʉ to kuyai ho uh ne kiokai, te sonʉhe to vasu.
S.TRANSL: 我開車去教會，開車比搭公車方便。
I will drive to the church because it is more convenient than the bus.

S.FORM: mo cum’u to emoo suu ’o mo meoi no ’oyonamhia macucuma?
S.TRANSL: Is the market close to your house?

S.FORM: o’a te, la’u yonto ’otovai ho la’u uh to mo meoi no ’oyonamhia macucuma.
S.TRANSL: 不近，我都騎摩托車去超市。
No, it is not, so I always ride the motorcycle to the market.
Is the post office close to the school?
Yes, it is within walking distance.
Is the restaurant close to the station?

S.FORM: c’o akameosʉ ho te i’mi ta toosva kuyai ho coeconʉ.
S.TRANSL: 出車站再走五分鐘就到了。
It only takes five minutes after you walk out of the station.
I would like to visit you.

S.FORM: o’a te’o’so yon ta emoo, aiti ho mahuhucma.
S.TRANSL: 我今天有事不在家，改天吧。
I am out today. How about another day?

S.FORM: te nana ʉmnʉ ho hucma? ta’u biebini ho ta’esi no cohzona.
S.TRANSL: 那你明天有空嗎?我下午去找你。
Then, are you available tomorrow? I’ll visit you tomorrow afternoon.
Sure, I will wait for you at home.

S.FORM: te’o peela loku’ing ’e fihngau suu, ta’u ucea poa tposʉa.
S.TRANSL: 請問我可以錄音嗎?我想做紀錄。
Would you mind if I do the voice recording? I would like to keep a record.

S.FORM: te’o peela sasing no poa televi?
S.TRANSL: Would you mind if I do the video recording?

S.FORM: o’a te, o’a mi’o yonghu, maezo esku’u si macucuma ta emoo.
S.TRANSL: 我不好看，倉庫也沒整理，不要啦。
No, I am plain and the warehouse hasn’t been tidied up yet.
Then I will just take photos.
Thank you for accepting the interview.

S.FORM: naho tuocosʉ. Cuma nan teko ucea cohivi?
S.TRANSL: You are welcome. What would you like to know?

S.FORM: cuma na osuu la hioa ne mosuu n’a fionana?
S.TRANSL: 請問您年輕時是做什麼的?
What do you do when you are young?

S.FORM: mo’u la kengsacu, at’inghi mi’o cu tosvo maitan’e.
S.TRANSL: 我以前是警察，但我現在退休了。
I was a police officer but I am retired now.
Then, are you working at the moment?

S.FORM: mio maezo yon ta hosa na oko suu?
S.TRANSL: 請問您的孩子也住在部落嗎?
Do your kids live in the tribe too?
不，我的孩子在都市居住。
No, my kids are all living in the city.
Then, do you live by yourself?

S.FORM: mi’o aʉt’ʉcʉ to av’u ho zomʉ, la’u c’o acʉha teai ’oahngʉ’u.
S.TRANSL: 我還有養一隻狗和一隻鳥，他們也是我的家人。
I also keep a dog and a bird. They are my family.

S.FORM: mi’o maezo aʉt’ʉcʉ to ngiau, la’u koa o’te nama nac’o homo c’o noachi.
S.TRANSL: 我也有養一隻貓，有動物陪伴不會無聊。
I have a cat too. I won’t get bored with the company of my pet.

S.FORM: os’o ucea tuocosi ho la hoseoyʉ ne noana’o ’e cou.
S.TRANSL: 我想請問你關於打獵的禁忌。
I would like to ask you about the taboos of hunting.

S.FORM: o’a mi’o nama bocbochio, ’a te’o yut’ingha na os’o cohivi.
S.TRANSL: 我知道的不多，但我能回答的都會回答你。
I don’t know much about that, but I will tell you everything I know.

S.FORM: pano peisiasi to la tititha hoseoyʉ ci macucuma?
S.TRANSL: 你們打獵的武器有什麼禁忌嗎?
Do you have any taboos about hunting weapons?
我們打獵的武器不可以讓女生碰到。
Our hunting weapons are untouchable to women.
那女人可以一起去打獵嗎?
Then, can women go hunting together?

S.FORM: o’a te, o’a la hioa to maamespingi na hoseoyʉ.
S.TRANSL: 不行，女人也不可以打獵。
No, women cannot go hunting either.

S.FORM: pasuya, uk’a na viiciu, teko n’a uh ne’e ho mhino.
S.TRANSL: pasuya，家裡沒有酒了，你去買米酒。
pasuya, our home is out of rice wine, please go and buy some.

S.FORM: ’a panto mo n’a cono pania ne suiziva, ’ancu te ’ahʉyʉ mhino!
S.TRANSL: 廚房裡還有一瓶，不用買吧!
There is still one bottle left in the kitchen, so there is no need to buy one!

S.FORM: moc’o cono pania, o’a te amso, ivaho n’a mhino no te yuso no pania.
S.TRANSL: 一瓶不夠，再去買兩瓶回來。
One bottle is not enough for me, go and buy two more back.

S.FORM: te’o mhino no viiciu, pano n’a?
S.TRANSL: I am looking for rice wine. Do you have any rice wine?
Yes! How many bottles do you need?

S.FORM: poa yuso no pania, hon’a cono cfua ci fʉesʉ.
S.TRANSL: 我要買兩瓶，還要買一包米。
I want two bottles and a pack of rice.
米在這裡，你還需要什麼嗎?
Here is the rice, what else do you need?

S.FORM: te’o n’a maezo mhia fcuyu, pano?
S.TRANSL: I want some eggs too, do you have some?
I want to buy some clothes.
What kind of clothes do you like?

S.FORM: te’o mhino to mo nanʉhtʉ ’o suyusi.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy the clothes with short sleeves.
We have white and green ones too.
請給我一件綠色的衣服。
Please give me the clothes in green.

S.FORM: pasuya, mimu uh nenu ne soni? Peohpeayofʉ?
S.TRANSL: pasuya你剛剛去哪裡了?你去運動嗎?
pasuya, where have you been just now? Did you go exercising?

S.FORM: o’a, os’o to’usni ’o ba’i’u ho phieni ’o lasi emʉ’a ci macucuma.
S.TRANSL: No, I went grocery shopping for my grandma.

S.FORM: ’ia mamo maica. pano teko hioa ho yofna? uh tan’e teto eaabobonʉ.
S.TRANSL: 這樣啊。你晚上有沒有空?要不要和我一起吃飯。
No wonder! Are you available at night? Would you like to have a meal with me?
No, I want to buy some clothes.
Then, I will go with you.

S.FORM: yokeoasu, te pio na huphina ta chae?
S.TRANSL: 你好，請問這把菜多少錢?
Hello, how much is this bunch of vegetables?
The vegetables are $20 for a bunch.

S.FORM: te pio na huphina ta f’ue?
S.TRANSL: How much are these sweet potatoes?

S.FORM: te’o yuso no efʉta ci chae ho kinkini si f’ue poa auseoseolʉ 30 na huphinasi.
S.TRANSL: 請給我兩把菜和30元的地瓜。
Please give me two bunches of vegetables and thirty dollars of sweet potatoes.

S.FORM: pasuya, os’o ta’payo’a ’o ’empicu’u, teko peela yuvahneni a’o?
S.TRANSL: pasuya，我忘了帶筆，你可以借我嗎?
pasuya, I forgot to bring my pen. Can you lend me one?

S.FORM: mi’o maezo uk’as’a. ’a nuu to tanivu eni.
teko peela yuvahneni n’a a’o? ta’u c’o osna yoveia.
S.TRANSL: 那可以借我一下子嗎?我很快就還你。
Can you lend me the pen for a second? I will return to you immediately.
Thank you and thank tanivu for me.

S.FORM: te’o yoveia ’e mo yuso ci tposʉ.
S.TRANSL: I want to return these two books.
No problem and what else do you need?

S.FORM: te’o i’vahon’a yovaho ta mo tuyu ci tposʉ.
S.TRANSL: I would like to borrow these three books.

S.FORM: os’o cohivi, talʉa yoveia ho tena c’u miteuhi.
S.TRANSL: 好了，記得三天後要拿來還。
Sure and remember to return them after three days.
You haven’t returned me the eraser.
那我的橡皮擦怎麼不見了?
Then, why is my eraser missing?
Did you lend it to pasuya?
I don’t know. I will go and ask her.
I will lend you my eraser first.

S.FORM: tanivu, isi yuvahneni suu to pasuya ’e ocmʉyʉ ci yʉsʉ?
S.TRANSL: tanivu, did pasuya lend you this coat?

S.FORM: o’a s’a, ’a isi phini to ino’u.
S.TRANSL: 不是，這是我媽媽買給我的
No, my mom bought it for me.

S.FORM: mo totiski to ocmʉyʉ ci yʉsʉ to pasuya.
S.TRANSL: voyu’s coat is the same as yours.

S.FORM: mo koa’onga ’o ocmʉyʉ ci yʉsʉsi, mo yupa h’unasi ta nuuto.
S.TRANSL: 他的外套是黑色的，我們的顏色不一樣。
His coat is black, so our colors are different.

S.FORM: tanivu, miko yuvaho no peisu to pasuya?
S.TRANSL: tanivu, did you borrow money from pasuya?
有，我本來今天要還他，我忘記帶錢了。
Yes, I was supposed to return to him today, but I forgot to bring the money.
Then, when will you return the money?
I will return to him tomorrow.
Okay, I will tell pasuya for you.

S.FORM: la titho to tocʉfʉ ho te tʉtpʉtʉ to buhci, la titho to feo’isi ho te tʉtpʉtʉ to toevosʉ.
S.TRANSL: 老鼠應該要⽤⽯壓式陷阱抓，⽵雞應該要⽤套頸式陷阱抓，這樣才對。
It is correct to catch mice through rangay and catch bamboo partridges through qjiulang.

S.FORM: ’ie ma mo maica, ko’ko o’a mi’o ahtu ticunu.
S.TRANSL: 原來是這樣，我都搞錯了！難怪我都抓不到。
No wonder! I am mistaken and that’s why I cannot catch any of them.

S.FORM: te’o no i’vaha pa’cohieni ho la moyai ta h’oepona.
S.TRANSL: 那我再教你怎麼製作這兩種陷阱。
Then I will teach you how to set up these two traps.

S.FORM: ’a teno, ta’u la ko’ko meelʉ tov’ohʉ no yuansou.
S.TRANSL: 好啊，太棒了！這樣我以後就會抓到獵物了。
Great! I will be able to catch the prey in the future.

S.FORM: micu taacvo’hi si kukuzo ta chana, uh ne tvosiamacucuma ho mayo to poyave, teto n’a uh ne chana.
S.TRANSL: 田裡的草太長了，你去倉庫拿鐮刀，我們去田裡。
The grass in the fields is too tall. Go to the warehouse to take the sickle and let’s go to the fields.

S.FORM: si soteuna to apngu, ’a tako teolʉi.
S.TRANSL: 在圓簍的旁邊，你進去倉庫就會看到了。
It is next to the round basket. You will see it when you enter the warehouse.

S.FORM: bumemealʉ ho teko yaa, ’a mo na’no feofeo ’o poyave.
S.TRANSL: 小心拿，不要受傷。鐮刀很利。
Be careful and don’t get hurt. The sickle is very sharp.
我的陷阱在那棵樹的下面。
My trap is under that tree.

S.FORM: mo’u moyai huomzi, ’a os’o cohivi mo yonenu ’o h’oepona’u.
S.TRANSL: 我在這邊有做記號，我知道我的陷阱在哪裡。
I make a mark here, so I know where my trap is.

S.FORM: ’a yungu eni, la titha yaa yoskʉ.
S.TRANSL: 這是魚筌，我們放在溪邊捕魚。
This is a fish trap which we put beside the river for fishing.

S.FORM: uk’a s’a yungumza, lamza c’o tualungu.
S.TRANSL: 我們那邊沒有魚筌，我們都用釣竿抓魚。
We don’t have any fish traps there, so we catch fish with a fishing rod.

S.FORM: o’a mo’u la ahtu tualungu, tako n’a la pa’cohivi a’o zou?
S.TRANSL: 我沒有用過釣竿，你下次教我好嗎?
I have never used a fishing rod before, would you mind teaching me next time?

S.FORM: ta’u lea, ’a tato no ipopohʉ tualungu.
S.TRANSL: 好啊，我們下次一起去釣魚。
Sure! Let’s go fishing together next time.

S.FORM: ho mio ta’u pa’cohivi mooyai yungu.
S.TRANSL: I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

S.FORM: si lungu suu micu yaa boecʉ ci yoskʉ, naho cu e’tʉi.
S.TRANSL: 你的釣竿動了，是不是有魚上鉤了!你快拉起來。
Your fishing rod is moving. Isn’t the fish on the hook? Pull it up!

S.FORM: ’otemocu, moso na’no tmaʉzʉ ’e ’apangʉ, te’o yon tan’e ho e’tʉ, teko n’a uh ta’e ho yaa ta ’ami.
S.TRANSL: 等等，船太晃了，我在這邊拉釣竿，你去那邊幫我拿網子來。
Wait, the ship is rolling heavily. I am here to pull the fishing rod and you should go there to grab me the net.

S.FORM: ’a teko no e’uni tan’e na yoskʉ, te’o to’unu e’yʉ.
S.TRANSL: 你把魚拉到我這邊，幫妳拉起來。
Pull the fish to my side and I will help you pull it up.

S.FORM: mainecumo maitan’e, cu ngangcʉngcʉ ’e yoskʉ. ʉmnʉ ci hia tov’ohʉ.
S.TRANSL: 太好了!今天大豐收，魚簍都裝滿了。
Great! It is a bumper crop today with full fish baskets.

S.FORM: teto cu maine’e ho angaezneni to maa’oahnguto.
S.TRANSL: 我們快回去和大家分享。
Let’s go back immediately and share it with everyone.
不要再玩了，快坐在座位上。
Stop playing and quickly sit in your seat.

S.FORM: mo maiuemo maitan’e, te tosvo ho hucma, tato nʉthʉ mimiyo!
S.TRANSL: 今天星期五，明天放假，一起出去玩吧!
It’s Friday today, we have a day off tomorrow. Let’s go out and play together!
Great! Let’s go to the riverside.
What day will it be tomorrow?

S.FORM: te maiuteu ho hucma, tato peispak’i no mali ho atavei no cohzona ho hucma!
S.TRANSL: 明天星期三，我們明天下午去玩球吧!
Tomorrow will be Wednesday. Let’s go play ball tomorrow afternoon!

S.FORM: cuma na tako hioa ho hucma?
S.TRANSL: What will you be doing tomorrow morning?

S.FORM: te maikayo ho hucma, temia yuyuso ’o ino ho uhne kiokai.
S.TRANSL: 明天是星期日，我要和媽媽去教會。
Tomorrow will be Sunday, I will be going to church with my mom.

S.FORM: mi’o mici teavto, te’o uhne tote’ia.
S.TRANSL: I feel like vomiting. I need to go to the restroom.

S.FORM: lema’cohio, mo congo ’e bʉyo’u, te’o uhne tote’ia.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我肚子痛，我要去廁所。
Teacher, I have a stomachache. I need to go to the restroom.
May I go wash my hands?

S.FORM: tec’u mon’i tosvo, totea na’a hocu uhne’e.
S.TRANSL: It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

S.FORM: lema’cohio, mo na’no congo co fnguu’u, te’o m’ea tosvo no atatvei no cohzona.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我頭好痛，下午要請假。
It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.
Okay, take care and go home.

S.FORM: lema’cohio, ta’u m’ea tosvo ho tena maiucni, ta’u poa aitneni to leaotothomʉ.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我下禮拜一要請假，我要去看醫生。
Teacher, I need to take a sick leave next Monday. I have to see a doctor.

S.FORM: mo congo ’o bʉyosi, mo yone tote’za.
S.TRANSL: She has a stomachache. She’s in the restroom.

S.FORM: mo, congo ’o vihi to pasuya, mo m’ea tosvo maitan’e.
S.TRANSL: Teacher, pasuya has a sore throat. She took a sick leave today.

S.FORM: zou mo’o vayaeana na a’o, mi’o cu tomaska ta tonsoha.
S.TRANSL: My name is mo’o vayaeana, and I’m 10 years old.

S.FORM: zou oko no cou suezopʉ nenu na suu?
S.TRANSL: What ethnic group are you from?

S.FORM: zou acʉhʉ cou suezopʉ na mimu conoemoo?
S.TRANSL: 你的家人都是原住民嗎?
Are all your family members indigenous?

S.FORM: ’a zou, zou acʉhʉ cou a’toana ’e mimia conoemoo.
S.TRANSL: 是的，我們全家都是鄒族人。
Yes, my whole family is Cou.

S.FORM: zou acʉhʉ cou suezopʉ na conoemoosu?
S.TRANSL: 你的家人都是原住民嗎?
Are all your family members indigenous?

S.FORM: o’asa’a, ’a cou a’toana ’o amo’u, zou puutu ’o ino’u.
S.TRANSL: 不是，我的爸爸是鄒族，我的媽媽是漢人。
No, my father is Cou, and my mother is Han Taiwanese.

S.FORM: zou oko no sia na suu?

S.TRANSL: 那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: zou amosu na tonoi? micu topioha?
S.TRANSL: 那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: o’as’a, ’a mameoi ta you, micu tomvoevʉha.
S.TRANSL: 不是，他是我們部落的耆老，他80歲了。
No, he is an elder of our tribe. He is 80 years old.

S.FORM: mio na’no mameoihe suu na ohaeva nosu hahocngʉ?
S.TRANSL: 你哥哥年紀比你大很多嗎?
Is your brother much older than you?

S.FORM: cu noana’o ho o’te yupa baito, ’a mikocus’a asuhcu bankake?
S.TRANSL: 好久不見，你是不是長高了?
I haven’t seen you in a while. Have you grown taller?

S.FORM: te’o uhne pankongsʉ ho i’eima ’o lema’cohio.
S.TRANSL: I’m going to the office to see the teacher.
He’s going to throw away the trash.

S.FORM: ’a mita yonto ’oyona yuuhnguzu, tata cu yupa toosa’o no yuuhnguzu.
S.TRANSL: 他在游泳池，他等一下要比賽游泳。
He’s at the swimming pool. He’s going to compete in a swimming competition later.

S.FORM: mo yonenu ’o sayungu? tenata cu yupa toosa’o no peayofʉ.
S.TRANSL: sayungu在哪裡?她等一下要比賽跑步。
Where is sayungu? She’s going to compete in a running competition later.

S.FORM: ’a mita yonto lii-thang, te’o eno usa ho yooho’a.
S.TRANSL: She’s in the auditorium. I’ll go call her.
Let’s go to the playground together.

S.FORM: te’o na’a mhia ocohiona, ta’u cu i’eima suu.
S.TRANSL: 我先去買午餐，等一下去找你。
I’ll go buy lunch first, and then I’ll meet you later.

S.FORM: teto eno yuyuso ho hafa na cʉyʉ!
S.TRANSL: Let’s carry the lunch boxes together!

S.FORM: biebimi no mocmo, te’o i’eima ’o lema’cohio.
S.TRANSL: 你找別人，我要去找老師。
You find someone else, I’m going to find the teacher.

S.FORM: te yupa toosa’o no chueichiu ’o tibusungu maitan’e?
S.TRANSL: Is tibusungu competing in croquet today?

S.FORM: o’ate, teta yupa toosa’o no smoepepe.
S.TRANSL: No, he’s competing in high jump.

S.FORM: tako i’upu note yupa toosa’o hote ’untookai?
S.TRANSL: 運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎?
Will you compete in the sports day?

S.FORM: ’a ta’u eno, ta’u i’upu to yupa toosa’o no toemayahe.
tako yuyafo no yupa toosa’o ho tena hiesi no ’untookai?
S.TRANSL: 運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎?
Will you compete in the sports day?

S.FORM: ’a ta’u i’upu to yupa toosa’o no chueichiu.
cuma na tato hioa ho tena ’untookai?
S.TRANSL: 我們運動會那天要做甚麼?
What will we do in the sports day?

S.FORM: tato yupa toosa’o no yupa ee’tʉyʉ.
S.TRANSL: We will compete in tug of war.
我們運動會要賣食物嗎?
Will we sell food at the sports day?

S.FORM: ma miko mayo tomo ti-’i-ming, a’ʉmtʉ kuici meemealʉ!
S.TRANSL: 你獲得了第一名耶，真是厲害！
Congratulations on getting first place! You’re amazing!

S.FORM: ’a mio, mita yonto hopo ho oengʉtʉ.
S.TRANSL: Yes, she’s sleeping in her room.

S.FORM: o’amos’a, mita emoyafo, tena maine’e ho yofna.
S.TRANSL: 不在，她剛出去了，要晚上才回家。
No, she’s not. She just went out and will be back in the evening.

S.FORM: ’a mita yone nikai, naho eno usa ho i’eima.
S.TRANSL: He’s upstairs. You can go up and find him.

S.FORM: ’iama yapasuyongʉ, noana’va o’te aiti na suu, leako ʉm’ʉmnʉ?
S.TRANSL: 是yapasuyongʉ阿，很久沒有看到你了，你好嗎?
It’s yapasuyongʉ. I haven’t seen you in a while! How have you been?

S.FORM: ’a lea’u na’no ʉm’ʉmnʉ! os’o i’eima suu ho toa ya’ei.
S.TRANSL: I’m doing great! I came to chat with you.

S.FORM: mita yonto ’oyona pei’i ho cmuecuyu to chae, te’o eno usa ho yooho’a.
S.TRANSL: 他在廚房炒菜，我去叫他。
He’s in the kitchen cooking. Let me go call him.

S.FORM: ’a mita uhto emoo no teo’ua ho tʉtpʉtʉ to teo’ua.
S.TRANSL: She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

S.FORM: o’amos’a yonta emoo ’o ak’i, mo yone ezoyʉ,, temu yonta emoo ho totea.
S.TRANSL: 你們的爺爺不在家，他在田裡，你們在家等他回來吧。
Your grandfather is not at home. He’s in the field. Wait for him to come back.

S.FORM: noana’va o’te aiti, ma mikocu yubankake.
S.TRANSL: I haven’t seen you in a while. You’ve grown taller.

S.FORM: na’no kokaekaebʉ ho os’o aiti na suu ho miko cmʉ’ho.
S.TRANSL: It’s so good to see you.

S.FORM: na eni te’o faeni muu ci ’ungeai, te siya no tvoyuhoa.
S.TRANSL: 這是給你們的鳳梨，要放到冰箱裡。
Here’s a pineapple for you. Put it in the refrigerator.

S.FORM: miko cu noana’o o’te uhtan’e, te’o eho’ʉ ho toehungu bonʉ.
S.TRANSL: 你這麼久沒來，我邀請大家一起來吃飯。
It’s been a while. Let’s have a meal together.

S.FORM: o’ate ’ahʉyʉ, te’oc’o mimo no ’ocea, teto uhto aemana ho yoya’ei.
S.TRANSL: 不用麻煩了，我喝茶就好，我們來客廳聊天。
No need to bother. I’ll just have tea. Let’s sit in the living room and chat.

S.FORM: ’aveoveoyʉ ho iko aʉt’ʉt’ʉca, te’o cu maine’e.
S.TRANSL: 謝謝你的招待，我要回去了。
Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

S.FORM: isin’a ala chua si teo’ua, teko hafa maine’e ho oupopoha’va.
S.TRANSL: 這隻雞剛殺好，你帶回去慢慢吃。
This chicken was just freshly killed. Take it home and enjoy it slowly.

S.FORM: teto na’a yupa esvʉtʉ no yupa baito ho ataveisi no cohzona ho hucma.
S.TRANSL: 我們約明天下午見好嗎?
Can I make an appointment with you tomorrow afternoon?

S.FORM: ’uatee, teto esvʉtʉ no yupa baito nenu?
teto esvʉtʉ ho yone ’oyonatmopsʉ zou? tato tas’ongka.
S.TRANSL: 我們約學校好嗎?我們要錄影。
How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.

S.FORM: ma tee eno uhne kuba, ta’u sʉ’eʉsʉ to yʉsʉ no cou.
S.TRANSL: 那去聚會所好了，我會穿族服去。
Then let’s go to the community center. I’ll wear folk costume.

S.FORM: la na’no yonghu ’o yufoyonʉ ta hosa homo seolʉa no bʉvnʉ, tako totea ho tena bʉvnʉ ho i’eima a’o.
S.TRANSL: 我們部落的櫻花盛開很漂亮。等花開的時候你來找我吧!
The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!

S.FORM: ma tee eno mooteo no hofungahoa, ’a tee eno angu poha’o!
S.TRANSL: 那要等到春天，太晚了吧!
That would have to wait until spring. It’s too late, isn’t it?

S.FORM: ma tako eno uhtan’e no mayasvi!

S.TRANSL: Alright! I’m looking forward to it!

S.FORM: te’on’a tuocosi, mainci miko mici yuovei ta hosa ho h’oyunsou?
S.TRANSL: 我請問你為甚麼要搬回部落生活?
May I ask why you decided to move back to the tribe?
I want to return to teach at the local school.

S.FORM: mainci o’te yone ngeesangsi ho ma’cohio?
S.TRANSL: Why not teach in the city?

S.FORM: la’u’so taaecingia ’e aesiiei hosa’u, yaeza ’ucea toovei ’e hosa’u.
S.TRANSL: 因為我懷念我的故鄉，也希望能回饋部落。
Because I miss my hometown and I also want to give back to the tribe.

S.FORM: ci miko na’no meemealʉ tme’si ,sia na moso ma’cohio suu?
S.TRANSL: 你很會織布，是誰教你的?
You’re very skilled at weaving, who taught you?

S.FORM: ’a i’e ba’i’u, ’a mita atva’esi meemealʉ tme’si ta hosa.
S.TRANSL: 是我的奶奶，她是我們部落最會織布的人。
It was my grandmother, she is the most skilled weaver in our tribe.
How did you develop an interest in learning weaving?

S.FORM: ’a ’oahngʉ to h’oyunsovamza, la’u ’ucea poa ticngicngihi ’e h’oyunsova.
S.TRANSL: 織布是我們的文化，我想要讓文化延續。
Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.

S.FORM: mo na’no mafe ’e emi no ton’u eni.
ci miko na’no meemealʉ, mio noana’o ho isi teai?
S.TRANSL: 你真厲害，這要釀很久嗎?
You’re really talented. Does it take a long time to make?

S.FORM: o’ate, tec’o cono mainsohʉ. la pe’eni ’o ton’u ho poa yompuhua, tac’u pei’i ho poa cuyua hocu hoyuha to apngu, poa na’a fosoa tac’u tiz’oz’a ho poa chumua hocu hoyuha to kaiyu..
S.TRANSL: 不用，大約一週就好了。把小米先搗成粉，再倒入大鍋煮熟，再倒到篩穀器具,清涼後手揉捏成液體,就可以裝到甕裡了。

No, it only takes about a week. The millet first pounded into powder, and then poured into a large pot to cook, and then poured into the sieve grain utensils, cooled and kneaded by hand into a liquid, can be packed into the urn.

S.FORM: mi’o yaa cuc’u ho pohe tan’e, ’a o’u iachia emʉ’a.
S.TRANSL: 我這裡有辣椒和玉米,我自己種的喔!
I have chili and corn, both grown by myself!

S.FORM: os’o ʉmnʉa ’e yʉsʉ eni, te supioi?
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡這件衣服，多少錢?
I like this piece of clothing. How much is it?

S.FORM: mo angu pepe, te peela ake’a poa cʉecʉ?
S.TRANSL: It’s too expensive. Can’t you lower the price a bit?

S.FORM: o’ate te’o sonsulu hoci angu cʉecʉ.
S.TRANSL: No, if I lower it further, I’ll lose money.

S.FORM: ’uatee! ma te’o eno yaa ’emo kua’onga ci yʉsʉ.
S.TRANSL: 好吧!那我要這一件黑色的衣服。
Alright then, I’ll take a black piece of clothing.

S.FORM: te’o yaa ’e fu’fu ho i’e tngoo.
S.TRANSL: 我要這把刀和這個鍋子。
I want this knife and this pot.

S.FORM: mo acʉhʉ suposiueso, na eni o’u iachia tiemuca ho teai, tee asansana peela noana’va titha.
S.TRANSL: 總共2000元，這是我自己手工打造的，保證可以用很久。
It’s a total of 2000 dollars. I handmade these, and they are guaranteed to last a long time.

S.FORM: ta’u eʉsvʉta to nanghia’u ho poa mhino, te meelʉ asuhcu cʉecʉ?
S.TRANSL: 我介紹朋友來買，可以再便宜一些嗎?
I’ll introduce my friend to buy. Can you give a further discount?
Alright! I’ll give you a 20% discount.

S.FORM: uhtan’e ho bobaito! ’e isi phieni ci yʉsʉ ho ceopngu.
S.TRANSL: 來看看喔!衣服帽子都有賣。
Come and take a look! We sell clothes and hats.

S.FORM: isi suse’tueva meemohʉ ’emo coni ci yʉsʉ, suposifou ’emo tuyu.
S.TRANSL: One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.

S.FORM: tec’o coni ’e te’o phini, fii’sio a’o nomo faeva.
S.TRANSL: 我買一件就好，請給我新的。
I’ll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.

S.FORM: ’aveoveoyʉ suu, mi’o mici mhia naveu hohʉ’eʉca ho fou toe’upi no ma’fʉ.
S.TRANSL: 你好，我想要買糯米飯和山胡椒滷肉。
Hello, I would like to buy sticky rice and braised pork with maqaw pepper.

S.FORM: cu psʉepʉngneni ’o naveu, panton’a chong-yoo-ping, teko mhino?
S.TRANSL: 飯賣完了。還有蔥油餅，你要買嗎?
The rice is sold out. I have tana pancakes, would you like to buy them?

S.FORM: ’uatee, poa cono oachia, ta’u i’vaho uhtan’e ho mhia naveu.
S.TRANSL: 好吧!請給我一份，我下次再來買飯。
Alright, please give me one. I’ll come back next time to buy rice.

S.FORM: ’uatee, te’o to’uni suu ho cfua to efucu, te sumeemohi.
S.TRANSL: W：好，我幫你用袋子裝起來，這樣50元。
Okay, I’ll pack it in a bag for you. That’ll be 50 dollars.
